Posts.Content: My husband was just diagnosed last week with PC. Gleason score: 9, age 61 Biopsy left lobe 5 out of 6 positive 4/4, 4/5. All 25-75%. PSA last year 1.7, this year 3.2 His GP told him to wait 4-6 months and get it checked again. Thank goodness he didn't listen and instead he went to a urologist for a second DRE which was abnormal and was able to get the biopsy done the next day! Given the high Gleason score, we have sought out a specialist and he will be having DaVinci surgery on Dec 9th Bone scan and rectal MRI were done today, we get the results Monday. We are, of course hoping it is still contained and researching all the available treatment options in case it isn't. This site has been a god send in seeing other's stories, learning what to expect and seeing the moral support. So happy to have found it!! Thank you!! Is there anyone else with a 9 Gleason score and low PSA? Is anyone active in any clinical trials? Thank you!!

Posts.Title: Recent diagnosis - Gleason score 9

Posts.Content: We think we found a good doctor. He has done over 1000 DaVinci procedures and we liked his approach. Still very scary but we are hoping for the best. Thank you!!!
Posts.Signature: November 2011 -Dx carcinoid cancer. Primary instestinal tumor + 4 lymph nodes. Successful surgery 1/2012. Likely not cured, but very slow growing and none detected on follow up exams. October 2014 annual physical PSA 3.2, up 1.5 from 2013. GP said to wait 4-6 months and re-check - went for 2nd opinion instead November 2014 second DRE w/ urologist determined abnormal Biopsy: 5 of 12 positive, all left lobe 4/4, 4/5. 25% to 75% 11/20 bone scan and recital MRI - waiting on results 12/9 DaVinci scheduled

Posts.Title: Recent diagnosis - Gleason score 9

Posts.Content: We heard from the doctor today. Good news / bad news. Bone scan was negative, no sign of met in lymph nodes so far but the rectal MRI did show that it extends beyond the capsule and involves the nerve bundles on the left side. Any good questions we should be asking at this stage?? Still meeting with the doctor Monday AM, DaVinci planned for the 9th, radiation will follow. Thoughts?

Posts.Content: Not sure about urologists in the area, but if you need a good PC surgeon, we are using Dr. Michael N. Ferrandino, MD at Duke. We've been pleased so far.
